item.title: Flashing a different firmware for the Atreus keyboard
item.description: I just bought an Atreus keyboard and I’m now configuring my own firmware. To do that, I’m using the qmk_firmware. I’m adding a new file as a layout (link here) and I have to change tmk_core/common/avr/bootloader.c to be able to compile it: -uint32_t reset_key __attribute__ ((section (".noinit"))); +uint32_t reset_key __attribute__ ((section (".noinit,\"aw\",@nobits;"))); After that, I just had to get the keyboard to the reset mode via fn + ESC (to change the layout) and then pressed the RESET button.
